trans-unit.source: Represents a declaration for a method of a type.
<xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod> can be used to represent the declaration for a method.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.ReturnType%2A> property specifies the data type of the method's return value.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.Parameters%2A> property contains the method's parameters.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.Statements%2A> property contains the statements of the method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod> object.

Gets the data types of the interfaces implemented by this method, unless it is a private method implementation, which is indicated by the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.PrivateImplementationType"></xref> property.
The types referenced by this collection must consist of interfaces.

If this <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod> represents a declaration for a public method, and this method implements a method on an interface, the interface or interfaces this method implements a method of should be referenced in this collection.
The method should still have the same name as the method of the interface that is implemented by this method.
For some languages, like C#, this has no effect on the syntax.
For others, like Visual Basic, there is a special syntax for implementing interfaces.
If the method is privately implementing a single interface, the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.PrivateImplementationType%2A> property should be used instead.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeTypeReferenceCollection"></xref> that indicates the interfaces implemented by this method.
Gets the parameter declarations for the method.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeParameterDeclarationExpressionCollection"></xref> that indicates the method parameters.
An event that will be raised the first time the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.ImplementationTypes"></xref> collection is accessed.
An event that will be raised the first time the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.Parameters"></xref> collection is accessed.
An event that will be raised the first time the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod.Statements"></xref> collection is accessed.
Gets or sets the data type of the interface this method, if private, implements a method of, if any.

If this <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod> represents the declaration of a private method and the method implements a method of an interface, this property should indicate the interface type that the method is implementing a method of.
The type referenced by this property must be an interface.

A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeTypeReference"></xref> that indicates the data type of the interface with the method that the private method whose declaration is represented by this <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> implements.
Gets or sets the data type of the return value of the method.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeTypeReference"></xref> that indicates the data type of the value returned by the method.
Gets the custom attributes of the return type of the method.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclarationCollection"></xref> that indicates the custom attributes.
Gets the statements within the method.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeStatementCollection"></xref> that indicates the statements within the method.
Gets the type parameters for the current generic method.
A generic method contains one or more unspecified types known as type parameters.
A type parameter name stands for the type within the body of the generic declaration.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeTypeParameterCollection"></xref> that contains the type parameters for the generic method.
